sen.e: Kyonyo (27 October, 1558 - 6 November 1614) the twelfth chief priest of the Ishiyama Hongan-ji Temple.

sen.e: Kyonyo claimed to resist to the last and fought against Nobunaga ignoring the Imperial order for peace and shutting himself in Hongan-ji Temple, and was disowned by his father.

sen.j: 1592年に顕如が死去した後、長男である教如は本願寺住職の座を継ごうとしたが、それに対して豊臣秀吉がかつて父に義絶されたこと、信長と徹底抗戦した経緯などを理由に教如は後継者にふさわしくないと反対し、教如の異母弟の准如を後継者に指名した。
sen.e: After Kennyo died in 1592, his first son Kyonyo tried to succeed the chief priest of Hongan-ji Temple, but Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI opposed to the succeeding by Kyonyo with reasons that he was once disowned by his father, he resisted exhaustively against Nobunaga in the past, and so on, and appointed Junnyo, his half-brother, as the successor.

sen.e: However, when Ieyasu TOKUGAWA came into power after Hideyoshi's death, from the reason that Ieyasu was once troubled by the Ikko sect, started to intervene in the quarrel between Kyonyo and Junnyo.

sen.e: Ieyasu became to support Kyonyo, and after experiencing the espionage in the night before the Battle of Sekigahara (it was sensed by the Mitsunari ISHIDA side and was encountered in such dangerous situation that he had wrote farewell poem, but with the helps by Hidenobu ODA and others and hard fighting by his followers, he at last returned to Kyoto), he erected Shinshu-honbyo Mausoleum in Karasuma in Shichijo of Kyoto in 1602, with the Imperial sanction by the Emperor Goyosei on his background.

sen.e: Because of this, Hongan-ji Temple in Shichijo Horikawa, succeed by Junnyo, became to be called Nishi Hongan-ji Temple, and the religious community of Hongan-ji Temple was split into East and West.
